meanings.definition: To offer a discount that is too large.
meanings.sent1: The store manager decided to overdiscount the products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to overdiscount items, as it can lead to financial losses.
meanings.sent3: The shopkeeper accidentally overdiscounted the entire inventory, causing a rush of bargain hunters.
meanings.sent4: She tends to overdiscount her services, undervaluing her hard work.
meanings.sent5: The company had to close down due to consistently overdiscounting their products.

meanings.definition: The act of giving a discount that is excessive.
meanings.sent1: The overdiscount on the electronics made them sell out quickly.
meanings.sent2: Customers were delighted with the overdiscount on the latest fashion items.
meanings.sent3: The overdiscount at the store caused chaos as everyone rushed to grab the deals.
meanings.sent4: The company's constant overdiscounts led to a decrease in overall revenue.
meanings.sent5: The overdiscount was so significant that the store struggled to recover financially.
